Commentary: Rabada finds a little shape away from the bat first up, and some decent carry too as it's left alone
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: Rabada pushes a little too hard and over-steps. The next one will be a Free Hit. Well, it's a harsh call actually as replays suggest Rabada was marginally over the line.
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, 1 no ball

Commentary: fired in straight and on a length, a bottom-edged hack sending the ball onto the stumps. No harm done though, as it's a freebie
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: outswinger again from Rabada, curving away at 143km/h to beat the outside edge of an airy drive
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: oh dear, Rabada's radar is a little off in this over, and this one's too wide of off
just short of a good length, and Avishka leaves on height as the ball hits the seam and jags in off the track
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: sprayed wide of off again, and it's another wide
that's better, full and attacking the stumps to test Avishka's defence
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: Avishka hops to defend the final ball, and an extended first over eventually comes to an end
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: angled across the left-hander, who defends from the crease
rising outside off and Tharanga has a fiddle, but ball beats bat
nicely bowled, on a length and straight. Tharanga stays deep and defends from the crease
worked off the straight into the leg side, but he finds the field
Tharanga uses the angle to slash a single down to third man
Ngidi keeps things tight on off stump, Avishka getting back and across to defend
Commentary_short: Ngidi to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: Rabada aims full, Tharanga defending into the leg side
short, wide and Avishka's beaten on the cut by some extra bounce
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: slashed down to third man! Again there's with, and Avishka chops deliberately under it to slice the ball in the air
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, FOUR runs

Commentary: Rabada aims this one closer to off stump, Avishka defending
Commentary_short: Rabada to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: Avishka pokes defensively at a 144km/h length delivery, an inside edge bringing a single to short fine leg
Tharanga whips neatly off his pads, but a diving midwicket fielder stops the run. Sharp pace from Rabada, up around 147km/h
Avishka is a little loose on off stump as a full one seams in to him, but he gets enough bat on it to keep it out
Commentary_short: Ngidi to WIA Fernando, no run

Commentary: edged, and it flies past du Plessis at second slip! Athletic effort from the skipper, but the ball evades him
Commentary_short: Ngidi to WIA Fernando, FOUR runs

Commentary: and takes a catch! Markram had just been put there, and straight away he's held an edge at third slip. The ball rose up towards Avishka's splice and he couldn't keep it down, carrying at head height to Markram
Dismissal_text: WIA Fernando c Markram b Ngidi 9 (16m 15b 2x4 0x6) SR: 60.00

Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: on a length and honing in on off stump, Oshada leaning forward to defend
Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: strong end to the over, Ngidi sending down a bristling lifter outside off that Oshada stands tall to defend
Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: feathered through to de Kock! Rabada angles one full and right across him, Tharanga throwing his hands through a flat-footed drive, and South Africa have their second
Dismissal_text: WU Tharanga c †de Kock b Rabada 2 (21m 8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25.00

Commentary: Kusal stays deep and defends into the leg side
a little too straight, and he's worked into the leg side. Ah, and Rabada's over-stepped once again
South Africa put two men out in the deep on the leg side, but it's a bluff as Rabada instead aims for a yorker. But it slips out as a low full toss, and it's clubbed out to wide long on
Commentary_short: Rabada to BOP Fernando, FOUR runs

Commentary: full and straight, Oshada lunging forward to defend
Commentary_short: Rabada to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: nice and quick from Rabada at 148km/h, and it's accurate too as Oshada opts again for defence
Commentary_short: Rabada to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: tight end to the over, and Oshada's defence is similarly compact to keep it out
Commentary_short: Rabada to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: Ngidi attacks the off stump, Kusal coming forward to drive watchfully to mid off
Ngidi gives nothing away, keeping it in the channel, and Kusal is content defending to point
very nicely played by Kusal, who leans over a leg-stump half volley and lifts a glance cleanly over square leg. One bounce and it's over the rope
Kusal's got a bit more confidence in his footwork now as he steps smartly forward to drive to mid off
nudged off the pads for a single
pushed through outside off, and Oshada leaves it alone
Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: tapped defensively to cover
rising outside off, and Kusal rides it to guide to gully
Kusal's forward with bat and pad right together to keep this full one out
pushed through in the channel outside off, Kusal raising his hands to leave it alone
Rabada targets the pads, Kusal tucking defensively into the leg side
full, just outside off, and Oshada is forward to tap to mid off as Sri Lanka continue to grind
Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: Ngidi tests Oshada's patience outside off, the batsman opting to shoulder arms. Very much a Test feel to proceedings at the moment, with three slips and a gully still in place
Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: a length delivery seams in off the track, Oshada pressing forward to keep it out via a thick inside edge
Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: Oshada keeps his left elbow high, but can't find much timing or the right placement for his on drive
Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: rising off a length, outside off, and Oshada is back and across to defend
Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: Ngidi completes the maiden - his first - as a delivery tight on off stump is pushed defensively to cover
Commentary_short: Ngidi to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: Kusal presses his weight forward and pings mid off with a drive
and now he hops on a rising ball, nurdling it watchfully to leg
worked off the hip for a single through square leg
on a length, in the channel, and a patient Oshada stays deep to defend
Commentary_short: Rabada to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: out of the blue! This is a cracking shot from Oshada. The ball is full, and he meets it with a measured straight loft, checking the shot and timing it to perfection to send the ball bouncing over mid on
Commentary_short: Rabada to BOP Fernando, FOUR runs

Commentary: Rabada pulls his length back a shade, and Oshada's happy to defend this one
Commentary_short: Rabada to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: full, and it's driven back to the bowler, who collects in his follow through
extra bounce for Ngidi, and Kusal takes his bottom hand off the bat as he fends it into the off side
pushed straight down the ground, the ball bouncing past Ngidi and right between mid on and mid off to allow runs
the ball just stops on Kusal and he's too early into a drive, but it drops safely in front of mid off

overthrows! Kusal works into space on the leg side, and the throw from Phehlukwayo in the deep is wayward. A better throw, and this could have been the third run-out between this pair in the series, but the ball bounces past Rassie at the stumps and rolls out into the deep on the opposite side
and a defensive push ends the Powerplay
Oshada shows some intent, shimmying down at Andile's first ball and pushing uppishly to mid on
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: chopped down to third man for a single
Kusal whips his bat inside the line at the last moment as Phehlukwayo finds some lift outside off
Phehlukwayo keeps it in the channel, Kusal covering his off stump and raising his hands to leave
nudged into the leg side for a single
laced through point, Oshada getting up on tip-toe to get over a short, wide one, slapping it firmly and to the left of a diving point fielder
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, FOUR runs

Commentary: his first ball is delivered at 147km/h but drifts down the leg side and is flicked down to fine leg
just a little too straight again, and he's milked into the leg side for one
a little straight again, and Kusal finds a single
dug in outside off, Oshada dropping his hands as the ball rises past him
Commentary_short: Nortje to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: Nortje aims for middle stump at 144km/h, Oshada defending into the leg side
Commentary_short: Nortje to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: spiteful delivery from Nortje, the ball spitting like a Cape Cobra off a short length to jar Oshada's splice. The batsman deals with it well enough in the hand, taking the bottom hand off his fend
Commentary_short: Nortje to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: pushed through in the channel outside off, Kusal letting it pass
drifting in to the pads, and he's neatly flicked down to fine leg
Andile hones in on off stump, sturdy defence the response
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: Oshada swipes a little wildly at a full one, a thick inside edge bringing a single to square leg
angling in through the air towards off stump, Kusal defending back to the bowler
dug in short, and he's happy to duck underneath it
Oshada walks into a defensive push as Nortje steams in and fires down a 148km/h length delivery
Commentary_short: Nortje to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: angling in and straight, Oshada defending into the leg side
Commentary_short: Nortje to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: the ball rises in the channel, Oshada hopping to defend
Commentary_short: Nortje to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: Nortje keeps it tight, and with good pace too at 145km/h, Oshanda extending the defensive go-slow
Commentary_short: Nortje to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: dug in, but it's too short and balloons over the bat
worked off the hip and down to fine leg for a single

Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, FOUR runs
Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, no run
Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, no run
Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, no run
Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: ooh that hurt, came back in sharply from outside off and struck him on the right forearm. The physio comes out and he's getting his arm bandaged. It's the area just below the elbow

ducks into that almost Nortje follows up with a sharp bouncer, and he was ducking under it but it didn't rise as much as he thought, and he flicks the back of his helmet. Great take by de Kock, diving to his left and getting a glove to the ball to stop it
another short ball, but this one sails over him and he is able to duck under it
good length ball on the stumps, he gets behind it and defends. 146 kph
length ball, coming in a touch but ends up on the pads and he's able to flick it off his hips to fine leg for a single
another great short ball, back of a length on off and moving away a touch. He stays inside the line and takes his bat away, lets it go through
Commentary_short: Nortje to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: Bad radar there, too short and jagging in sharply. So sharply that it goes well down legside for a wide
some shape into the batsman, fuller ball on the fifth stump, clipped to midwicket
keeps it wide of off, on a length, allowing the batsman to free his arms and glide it down to third man
short ball, but not enough pace on it, and he's able to stay still and pull it from outside off to deep midwicket
that's a much quicker short ball, banged it in and put more effort, it goes at head height past the offstump. Marginal call on it being a wide, but the bowler gets away
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, and he slashes it, but straight to point. Fernando will feel he's missed out there, that sat up and asked to be hit
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: strays on the pads with a fuller deliver and he turns it around the corner to fine leg
fullish outside off, he comes on the front foot and steers it to point
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: good length on the stumps, he comes on the front foot to defend with a straight bat
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: he's read the length well that time, Tahir keeps it fullish and he goes down to paddle-sweep it from outside off to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: that almost carried back to Tahir The leggie turned a fair bit and the batsman got a leading edge on the flick, it was dying as it reached Tahir
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to BOP Fernando, no run
Imran Tahir to BOP Fernando, no run

Commentary: and there's the wicket great bowling by Tahir, classic legspinner's dismissal. Drew him forward with the loop, and though he took a big stride, he couldn't get to the pitch of the ball because it dipped. Pitched in line with the stumps and turned just enough to take a healthy outside edge. Slip completes a low catch
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to BOP Fernando, OUT
Dismissal_text: BOP Fernando c du Plessis b Imran Tahir 22 (70m 47b 4x4 0x6) SR: 46.80

Commentary: short and wide outside off, slashed away hard. Backward point dives but the ball is just wide of him. Deep cover runs around to his left to collect the ball
good length on off stump, he defends with a straight bat from his crease
shot too full and he's quick to flick it off his toes. Slightly aerial through short midwicket, but it was timed exceedingly well and races to the boundary
Phehlukwayo dives to his left at third man to save a boundary A healthy outside edge off a poke seemed headed to the fence till Andile sprinted and dived, to save the boundary
he's losing his lines a bit, this one is a length ball that ends up on the hips, and is flicked to fine leg comfortably
good length on off, better line. Steered to gully, where Markram dives and fields to stop any thoughts of a run
Commentary_short: Nortje to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: ooh nice drift, dip and turn. He went very deep into his crease to defend it, spun sharply from leg stump
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: tossed up, but too full outside off, allowing him to come on the front foot and drive gently to long-off
tossed up on off stump, and patted down the ground to long-on
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, 1 run

Commentary: a little too full again, which allows another gentle drive to long-on
good length outside off, steered to short third man off an open face.
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, 1 run

Commentary: ooh, that was the sucker ball, the one that would draw him into a loose shot. Well flighted, and drew him forward while dipping, but he manages to toe end it back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: past the outside edge. Short ball outside off and moving away a touch, he follows it with his hands but doesn't get a nick
Commentary_short: Nortje to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: another short one outside off, but this moved more sharply away, so he was able to pull his bat away in time after initially following the ball
Commentary_short: Nortje to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: fullish length on off, driven crisply but straight to mid-off
Commentary_short: Nortje to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: short and wide outside off, doesn't bounce as much as the first two balls and slashed to third man
back of a length outside off, Kusal stays very still and strokes it past point
good length on the pads, tucked to deep midwicket
nicely tossed up, pitching on middle and turning away. but dealt with well too, with a nice stride and a strong forward defence
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: length ball on leg stump, tucked into the leg side
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: good areas by Tahir again, nicely tossed up on middle stump and defended
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: subtle change in line, goes on off stump this time and draws him across to flick to midwicket
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: a touch too full on the stumps and pushed to long-on
sharply turning googly, from outside off, but he goes deep in his crease and plays it with the turn to midwicket
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, 1 run

Commentary: good length outside off, that bounced a bit more than he expected, and he ends up jabbing it down with feet static
Commentary_short: Pretorius to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: smashed too short and Angelo goes on the back foot to pull this in front of square. He can't bowl that length at that pace, unless he can get it to bounce steeply
Commentary_short: Pretorius to AK Perera, FOUR runs

Commentary: better length, on off and coming in a touch, but he moves across and tucks him to midwicket with soft hands to take a couple
good length on off, defended to point
Commentary_short: Pretorius to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: fullish outside off, glided to backward point by opening his bat face
Commentary_short: Pretorius to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, pushed to point
Commentary_short: Pretorius to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: fullish on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: full ball again, comes on the front foot to drive to long-on
nicely tossed up on off, but he gives himself some room and is able to extend his arms and drive this to long-off
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, 1 run

Commentary: wrong 'un, pitches on middle and turns away, flicked to short fine
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: tossed up and driven to long-on
quicker one on the stumps, but the batsman defends it solidly
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, steered to third man
fullish on off stump, he moved across and clipped it to Rabada at mid-on and steals a quick single. Rabada aims at the stumps and throws, but misses.
too short and he transfers weight back to pull forcefully, but there is a man at deep square leg
bouncer outside off, and he ducks harmlessly under it
Commentary_short: Pretorius to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: nicely timed push down the ground to a fuller ball, and Rabada has to sprint back from mid-on to slide and pull it in before the ball reaches the boundary
good length outside off, defended into the offside
full toss and whipped to deep midwicket with his wrists
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, 2 runs

Commentary: better length and flight, on off stump, he defends off the front foot
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: tossed up nicely again, he makes room to drive inside out, but straight to extra cover
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: flatter and quicker, he defends off the front foot and gets an inside edge that rolls to the bowler's right
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: a little short but he can't get hold of the forcefull pull, and under-edges to midwicket
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: tossed up outside off, driven to cover by opening the face of the bat
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, 1 run

Commentary: length ball on off, steered to third man by opening the face
bad ball, put away length ball ends up on the pads and he just has to tickle it fine to get it to the fence, which he does
on the pads again, and flicked to deep square leg this time. Ngidi running in doesn't pick up cleanly, allowing the second run comfortably
better line and length, outside off and defended back
back of a length, but it's slow enough at 126 kph that he can wait for it and flick it to fine leg from outside off
back of a length outside off, quicker that time and defended into the offside
Commentary_short: Pretorius to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: tossed up on leg stump and driven, but straight to mid-on
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: squirted to point from outside off
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Mendis, no run

Commentary: tossed up, ends up as a low full toss and he comes forward to pat it to long-on
good length, quicker one on the stumps, he goes back and defends
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: that's the ideal length, draws him forward to defend into the offside
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: just over short midwicket too short, quicker one loses its length and he pulls hard. Doesn't get it as high as he would have liked, but it's high enough to elude a leaping short midwicket and find the boundary
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, FOUR runs

Commentary: too straight on the pads, and turned to deep square leg
too short again, and slap-pulled from outside off to Ngidi at deep midwicket
better bouncer, rises up to head high, but he goes for the pull anyway. Does well to keep it down, to square leg
back of a length outside off, chopped to third man and that will be fifty for Kusal Mendis. Organised innings so far and he's looked good
top edge lands safe quick bouncer outside off, and he was too slow to get bat to it trying to pull, it takes the edge and pops up at square leg. Midwicket can't get there
length ball on the stumps, turned to midwicket
wrong un, clipped to square leg
full toss, drifts on the pads, and flicked, but straight to midwicket
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: well placed went for the slog-sweep, picked the googly and aimed for the gap at midwicket. Didn't time it perfectly but everything else worked and it goes to the boundary
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, FOUR runs

Commentary: leg-spinner outside off, he lets it through
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, no run

Commentary: he's got him! quicker one, slider, and Perera was stuck on the crease, neither forward nor back. It was on a length outside off and he ends up poking at it with feet static, ends up edging to slip
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to AK Perera, OUT
Dismissal_text: AK Perera c du Plessis b Imran Tahir 31 (40m 37b 3x4 0x6) SR: 83.78

Commentary: tossed up on off, he drives but gets the toe-end back to Tahir
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: he's overstepped good length on off, and defended back. But it'll be a free hit
great ball for a free-hit, sharp bouncer. He went to pull, got an edge and de Kock leapt up to collect above his head. But he's not out of course, due to the free hit
quick delivery, fullish on off stump, keeps a little low and he has to bring his bat down in a hurry to keep it out
length ball outside off, squirted to third man
back of a length outside off, he lets it go through, keeping bat tucked into his body
Commentary_short: Rabada to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: fullish on the stumps, defended back
Commentary_short: Rabada to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: rears up from a length outside off, and surprised him. He was coming forward but had to adjust. the ball hits the high part of the bat and runs down to third man
tossed up on the stumps, tried to clip it but the leading edge rolls to the bowler's left
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: beauty spins past his outside edge while he was going for the forward defensive
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: down leg and he over-balances, but de Kock can't collect cleanly. He breaks the stumps, but without the ball in his hand. If he had the ball, it would have been a stumping
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, 1 wide

Commentary: tossed up on the stumps, driven gently towards cover
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: doesn't read the googly, and it spins in sharply to hit him high on the thigh pad
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: another googly, this one not spinning as much, and it bounces above his attempted cut. Very close to glove, very close to stumps too
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: another googly and he just about keeps it out
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: fullish on the stumps, defended to cover
good length outside off, defended to point
short ball on the stumps, he rocks back, swivels and pulls to fine leg
sharp bouncer outside off, he was a little late to try and move across and pat it down, takes a faint inside edge and rolls to slip
Commentary_short: Rabada to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: fuller outside off, driven to cover
Commentary_short: Rabada to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: yorker length wide outside off, steered to third man
drifts on the pads and is tickled round the corner, but fine leg swoops in quickly to keep it to one run
tossed up outside off, he comes across and drives to long-on
tossed up on off, dipping nicely. He waits for it and clips to midwicket
Commentary_short: Duminy to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: bowls this well wide of off, and entices him into a sweep, stretching out. Pitches outside the tramline but turns in past the pat
Commentary_short: Duminy to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: length ball, tucked to midwicket
checks his drive and ends up feebly patting it back to the bowler
good length outside off, nipping in. Takes the outside half of the bat and rolls into the offside
Commentary_short: Nortje to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: good length outside off again, he chops it down to third man

mix up and run out that's a waste of a wicket. This was short and pulled to deep midwicket. they took one, then Priyamal called Mendis for a second. Mendis responded, Priyamal hesitated, but by then Mendis was too far down the track. Ngidi fired in a throw at the bowler's end and the bails were whipped off. Mendis had been batting well but has to go
back of a length outside off, dabbed down towards point
Commentary_short: Nortje to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: short and wide outside off but doesn't bounce high, he stands up on his toes to flay this through cover
good length on the stumps, pushed to cover for a quick single
tossed up, wide of off but inside the tramline. He lets it go through
Commentary_short: Duminy to NLTC Perera, no run

Commentary: tossed up on the stumps this time and Thisara defends it back
Commentary_short: Duminy to NLTC Perera, no run

Commentary: nice loop and dip, pitches on a length and turns away from the left-hander, but he pushes it into the offside with soft hands for a quick single
tossed up on leg stump and he brings out the sweep, but there is a man at deep square leg
almost chopped on! tossed up and tempting him to flay it outside off, but he inside edges on to pad.
Commentary_short: Duminy to NLTC Perera, no run

Commentary: tossed up again on off, driven firmly but straight to cover
Commentary_short: Duminy to NLTC Perera, no run

Commentary: good length outside off, punched to point
Commentary_short: Nortje to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: short and outside off again, given width and he punches it to deep point

pulled straight to Tahir at deep midwicket the short ball trap works. Thisara couldn't control his instincts, went for the pull when he saw it dug in, but this was climbing and he had to pull it from above his eye-line. Ends up hitting it straight to Tahir, who is as joyous as when he takes a wicket himself
Dismissal_text: NLTC Perera c Imran Tahir b Nortje 2 (8m 7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 28.57

Commentary: back of a length on the fourth stump line, pushed from close to his body into the offside

Commentary: another short ball, this one was quick too for a bouncer at 140 kph. Batsman went for the pull but too late on it, and doesn't connect
Commentary_short: Nortje to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, he slaps it from close to his body but can't get past point
Commentary_short: Nortje to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: too far down leg and it's a wide
nails the sweep tossed up on off and he knew there was a gap at a squarish fine leg, went down on one knee and swept it there
Commentary_short: Duminy to de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball on the stumps, pushed back
Commentary_short: Duminy to de Silva, no run

Commentary: length ball on leg stump, he waits for it and tucks it to short fine leg
tossed up on the stumps, he brings his bat down in a hurry to jab it to deep midwicket from the crease
paddled fine and it finds the fence. Chose his shot early and took this from middle stump and played it really fine. De Kock moved across to try and stop it, but couldn't
Commentary_short: Duminy to de Silva, FOUR runs

Commentary: floated up on leg stump and turning a bit, gets it a bit high on the bat on the way back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Duminy to de Silva, no run

Commentary: fullish on the pads, uses his wrists to turn it to deep midwicket
fuller outside off, driven back but without any power
Commentary_short: Nortje to de Silva, no run

Commentary: fullish length outside off, solid forward defensive offered
Commentary_short: Nortje to de Silva, no run

Commentary: gets some shape away from the batsman, almost yorker length on the fifth stump line. He wanted to square drive it, but it takes the inside edge to roll towards short fine leg
bouncer, and he ducks under it. It was dug in really short but just about went over him while he was ducking
Commentary_short: Nortje to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: tries for the yorker on the stumps, but is marginally off. Driven to mid-on
Commentary_short: Nortje to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: almost chopped the googly on! pitched on a length and bounced above his waist, which surprised him, he wanted to play it square on the offside. takes the inside edge
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: that's one of the strangest fours you will see. Runs down the track, gets into a tangle almost and ends up half inside edging, half tapping the ball to the fine leg boundary
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, FOUR runs

Commentary: fullish length defended to cover
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: shimmies down again but defends into the offside
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: nicely swept, picked it up from outside off and read the length early
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, 1 run

Commentary: leg-break on a length, he waits for it and punches it down to long-off
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to de Silva, 1 run

Commentary: shimmies down the track again, but Andile shortens his length outside off and he can only push it into the offside
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to de Silva, no run

Commentary: pops a catch to Duminy at midwicket soft dismissal. Short ball outside off, and he wanted to pull it, but gets it too low on the bat and Duminy easily catches a simple offering
Dismissal_text: DM de Silva c Duminy b Phehlukwayo 12 (14m 12b 2x4 0x6) SR: 100.00

Commentary: back of a length on the pads, pushed into the legside for a quick single
too much outside off and that will be a wide
back of a length again, doesn't come on to the bat. He goes for the pull, doesn't get any timing, but luckily doesn't pop a catch. Keeps it on the ground to deep square leg
bouncer on off stump, he ducks under it
length ball outside off, he had room to free his arms and slash it, but hits it straight to Markram at backward point, who does well to stop the ball
another bouncer, he ducks under it again
length ball spinnning away from middle stump, jabbed to midwicket
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: fuller, driven to long-on
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, 1 run

Commentary: fuller on off again, slapped to deep cover
googly, pitches well outside off, but a bit short so he can wait for it and slap it through cover off the back foot
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to PARP Perera, 1 run

Commentary: oooh beauty. Another googly but this was fuller and he didn't pick it very well. Was coming forward to defend, but Tahir has got some of his googlies to bounce awkwardly. Pings him on the right glove
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Udana, no run

Commentary: length ball on the pads, spinning across, he gets behind the line to defend. round of applause from the crows because that is Tahir's last ball in ODI cricket at home He's been a great cricketer for them. He's going to the World Cup but will be done after that
Commentary_short: Imran Tahir to Udana, no run

Commentary: back of a length on the stumps, pulled to short fine off an under-edge
back of a length outside off, steered away but point dives and fields
back of a length, nipping in from outside off, he gets behind the line to defend towards cover
backing away to a back of the length ball outside off. It doesn't bounce much and he ends up slashing it in the air towards third man, but it bounces well in front of the fielder
strays on the pads, and he moves across to push it towards mid-on and take the single
back of a length, gets it to bounce more from outside off, he stays in his crease and steers it to third man from chest high
full ball angling into the stumps, pushed to mid-on and they take a quick single. Make it home despite a direct hit by the fielder

review taken for caught behind Bowler Rabada heard something, and so did I - not that my opinion counts - but Rabada has managed to convince du Plessis to go for a review despite de Kock saying he heard nothing. The batsman was backing away, and had an almighty heave, there was some sound as it went past him. But snicko shows nothing! So he'll be safe. My hearing might be off, but at least I have Rabada for company

full toss, pushed back to the bowler. He had wandered out of his crease, so Rabada collects on the follow through and fires it to the stumps, but his radar is a bit off and the batsman has to evade the throw
shot he was backing away to give himself room, but Rabada follows him with a bouncer. However, he adjusted beautifully and still pulled him powerfully for four
keeps this one full and straight outside off. The batsman tries to squirt it away but ends up feeling for it with cemented feet
full toss outside off, driven well but there is a man at deep point to prevent a boundary
strays down leg and he manages to tickle it fine for a boundary. Scratch that, it's off the thigh pad. Still four runs to Sri Lanka
fullish on off stump, bunted to midwicket
yorker on middle stump, clipped back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: goes for the bouncer outside off, but it's too short and too high. Wide
good length outside off, that keeps low. He tried to cut it away but it went under his bat, almost scooted along the ground
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: fullish on off, squirted to point
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: back of a length outside off again. Doesn't bounce much, defeats the attempted cut. Andile thinks there was something and appeals, but the umpire is unmoved. No reviews left either
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: nicely played. Full ball outside off and he carved it over point. Ngidi was running across and got there in time, but just couldn't collect the ball while trying to flick it back

great effort from Pretorius at long-on but that might not have carried Short ball from Rabada, and he uncorks a pull to a widish long-on, but doesn't get the timing quite right. Pretorius runs in and dives forward, but he's just grounded the ball. He wasn't celebrating and the soft signal was not out too.
that's a bad ball and it goes for runs. Leg-byes, but it was too far down leg, back of a length. He just needed to help it on its way fine, and though he did it off thigh pad, the runs count
Commentary_short: Rabada to PARP Perera, 4 leg byes

Commentary: fullish on off, defended into the offside for a quick single
back of a length on off, he moves across and goes on tip toes to defend it down into the legside. No one close in so they can take a quick single
short ball again, he goes for the pull, gets it too high on the bat, but it lands safely past midwicket
down the track, but this is another short ball. He manages to just pull it over midwicket, but without any timing
smashed full outside off and he carves it past point with a full blooded thrash
Commentary_short: Phehlukwayo to PARP Perera, FOUR runs

Commentary: slower ball outside off, he comes forward and drives it to extra cover
another slower ball, only 99 kph on off stump. He waits for it and nudges it gently to long-off
bouncer on off, rising up to the shoulders almost. He stays beside the ball and flat-bats it down to third man
slower ball again, wide outside off at just 93 kph. He went for the big swing to the off side, but ends up under-edging to the bowler
misses the yorker outside off and is driven fluently to the man on the cover boundary
launches into the slower ball, to long-off. Du Plessis runs in but realises he's not going to make it, so gets body behind the ball and ensures no boundary
full ball outside off, went for the expansive cover drive but misses. They appeal for a caught behind - I heard a noise again - but the umpire is unmoved again
Commentary_short: Nortje to PARP Perera, no run

Commentary: short ball, pulled away to deep square leg while swivelling. That's the fifty run partnership
yorker, takes the inside edge to short fine
walloped full ball on off and he comes on the front foot to swipe across the line and send it high over long-on.
keeps it full, fast and straight that time. Another attempted heave but he doesn't connect. The ball whistles past the off stump
stunning shot he backed away, Rabada followed and bowled a low full toss. He just punched it straight back, drilled down the ground for a four

good catch by Tahir again, at deep square leg Bouncer outside off, and he was shimmying down the track again. Tries to play a tennis ball smash from over his shoulder, ends up getting more height than distance. Tahir starts moving to his right, but the ball swirls to his left and he adjust and holds on.
Dismissal_text: I Udana c Imran Tahir b Rabada 32 (40m 29b 3x4 1x6) SR: 110.34

Commentary: two wickets in two balls This was full on the stumps, he backed away to swipe it across the line, but was too late on it, and splices it up in the air. Goes straight up, Rabada settles under it and catches it. On a hat-trick now
Dismissal_text: PARP Perera c & b Rabada 33 (89m 57b 2x4 0x6) SR: 57.89

Commentary: length ball outside off, rears up and he jabs it into the offside. Calls Malinga for the single to keep strike, but if point had hit, Malinga was miles out. Phehlukwayo missed though
full toss outside off, flayed through extra cover for a couple
slower bouncer over off stump, he was way too early into the pull and connected only with air

caught at midwicket Back of a length on off, and he wanted to swat it across the line but gets it off the toe-end. It pops up in the air, Duminy takes a couple of steps back and catches it. Sri Lanka fail to last 50 overs once again
Dismissal_text: A Dananjaya c Duminy b Nortje 3 (6m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 75.00

Commentary: Malinga comes around the stumps, de Kock coming forward to push a full, angled delivery to cover
Commentary_short: Malinga to de Kock, no run

Commentary: de Kock looks in excellent touch, and he's off the mark with a glance behind square as Malinga spears one into the pads
Commentary_short: Malinga to de Kock, FOUR runs

Commentary: there's some swing, the ball snaking in through the air to test de Kock's defence
Commentary_short: Malinga to de Kock, no run

Commentary: beaten outside off, the ball holding its line rather than coming in to de Kock as he pokes away from his body
Commentary_short: Malinga to de Kock, no run

Commentary: there's some swing again, and a firm flick is stopped at short midwicket
Commentary_short: Malinga to de Kock, no run

Commentary: low full toss, outside off, and it's tapped to cover
Commentary_short: Malinga to de Kock, no run

Commentary: turned with the spin into the leg side, and there's space for a single
this one rushes on with the arm, the ball coming off the inside half of de Kock's defensive push
Commentary_short: de Silva to de Kock, no run

Commentary: 'two, two, two!' shouts de Kock as soon as he slots this through cover, the fielder in the ring diving over it
Commentary_short: de Silva to de Kock, 2 runs

Commentary: well bowled! De Kock is done by the flight, the ball gripping and spinning past him and the keeper whipping the bails off in a flash. But the back foot is grounded
Commentary_short: de Silva to de Kock, no run

Commentary: a drive pings the cover field
Commentary_short: de Silva to de Kock, no run

Commentary: de Kock waits deep in the crease, chopping to point
Commentary_short: de Silva to de Kock, no run

Commentary: nice shape, the ball angling in and then swinging away as Markram comes forward and raises his hands into a leave
pushed through a little wider, and Markram lets this one go too
the cover fielder over-runs a shot tapped almost straight to him, and they pinch a quick single

Commentary_short: Malinga to de Kock, no run

Commentary: a checked punch bounces up off the turf to be stopped by point
Commentary_short: Malinga to de Kock, no run

Commentary: whipped out to deep square leg! This is the vital wicket for Sri Lanka, and it's come early. De Kock falls early today, lifting a leg-stump delivery powerfully but straight to Avishka in the deep. Well, not quite straight to him, but he's easily into position to hold the catch
Dismissal_text: Q de Kock c WIA Fernando b Malinga 6 (11m 14b 1x4 0x6) SR: 42.85

Commentary: full and angled across Markram, who comes forward to drive to mid off
caught and bowled goes down! Markram pushes too early at a full delivery, chipping a return catch. But it goes to Udana's right hand, which is not his strong hand, and it doesn't stick
Markram flashes a cut, but finds point
Udana shoots a length delivery across Markram's bows, the batsman raising his hands to leave
punched firmly, once again off the back foot but this time he threads the gap through cover point
a length delivery is dead-batted to point
Faf waits in the crease and fetches an outswinger into the leg side with some strong wristwork. Good running, too
an outswinger curves from leg to off, but Markram meets it with a straight bat and takes on mid on for a quick single
this takes off down the leg side, dug in short by Malinga but it positively burst off the surface, rising even over a leaping Kusal behind the stumps
Faf is half forward to push a gentle outswinger to point
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: punched to point
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: beaten outside off, again the ball lifting off the surface to beat Faf's flat-footed poke
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: pushed watchfully to mid off, this delivery behaving itself
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: cracking delivery, bursting through the channel outside off to beat Markram's outside edge. It went off the seam, and then swung after passing the bat
tight single! Markram drives to mid off and takes Thisara on in that position, who couldn't quite stop it cleanly
Udana keeps Faf on the back foot, hitting a short length that's pushed to cover
Commentary_short: Udana to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: angled across him, and it's wide enough to leave alone
Commentary_short: Udana to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: glanced off the pad, and quite fine on the leg side
Udana aims at the top of off, and Faf is forward to defend
Commentary_short: Udana to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: nicely bowled, the ball rising off a length just outside off to hit Markram's splice
a full length delivery squirts off a thick outside edge, bouncing down to third man
Sri Lanka think this has taken the glove, but the umpire signals leg byes. And it's the right call, the ball spitting off a length and bouncing off Faf's thigh on the way to the boundary
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, 4 leg byes

Commentary: punched firmly to cover, off the back foot
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: big swish outside off, du Plessis throwing his hands out at one that bounces and leaves him
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: well, this one keeps low now. Faf has to hurry a jab down at a ball that scuttles through below knee height. He keeps it out, and manages a wry smile at the pitch
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: Udana keeps it tight, on a length, and Markram defends
chopped hard, straight into the ground and bouncing to cover
Markram rides the bounce and guides to gully, but finds the fielder
beaten on the under edge, Markram cutting over the top of one that keeps a shade low
a firm drive is aimed straight at mid off
Markram is slightly squared up by one that angles across him, defending to cover
Faf keeps his eye on an outswinger, defending solidly on off stump
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: short, and a controlled pull bounces out to deep backward square, where Udana sprints to his left and dives to save the boundary
just short of a length outside off, and it's guided to gully
Commentary_short: Malinga to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: edged, but well wide of the slip and bouncing down to third man. Faf was troubled by the bounce outside off
Malinga slings one down full at off stump, Markram stepping forward to defend
tight end to another good over, Malinga keeping Markram honest with a length delivery on off stump
punched firmly to cover, who dives but parries the ball away and past mid off, who was running in as back-up, and they're back for three
a crisp drive is intercepted by a diving cover fielder
Markram lets out a pained yelp as the ball takes the inside edge and bounces into his box. But there's no major harm done
wonderful timing and placement from Markram, who walks into a drive, on the up, and laces it through the gap at cover point
dropped at cover! Markram sliced his drive and Oshada dived forward to get to it, but spilled the low chance. Udana ain't chuffed
du Plessis drives, and finds cover
Commentary_short: Udana to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: punched with the spin down to long on
du Plessis backs away and punches a ball right off his stumps. The shot's got power in it, and the cover sweeper can't get to it, despite making good ground. Too short from Akila
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to du Plessis, FOUR runs

Commentary: looped up a little closer to him, and du Plessis is forward to defend
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: fuller still, and Faf's front foot defence goes to point
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: floated up on middle and leg, and a drive goes to long on
invitingly full outside off, and Markram comes confidently forward to thread a drive through cover
angled across du Plessis, who steps forward and leaves well alone
Commentary_short: Udana to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: firmly thumped off the back foot, but cover sweeper cleans up
aimed much fuller this time, and Markram pushes defensively to cover
Markram gets back and across to force a length delivery away through cover, and they're back for the second
Markram walks across to off to upset his line, dispatching a glance straight through the large gap wide of midwicket

chopped down to third man for an ambled single. Faf takes it very easy getting up to the other end, and there's an appeal from Sri Lanka as the return from the deep hits the stumps ... but his foot is over the line, and that's the fifty stand
flicked with the spin, and down to long on
floated up on middle and leg, and Faf flicks across his pads for a single to square leg
beaten outside off! Variation from Akila, and Markram doesn't read it
Markram comes watchfully forward to smother a full one into the leg side
breaking from leg to off, but Markram reads this one and defends
off the edge of a driving bat, and the ball flies well past a diving slip fielder and down to third man
crunched firmly off the back foot and out to the cover sweeper
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to du Plessis, 1 run

Commentary: and Markram does the same, pinging the cover sweeper with a backfoot punch
pushed out slightly wider of the sweeper this time. Faf wants two, but there's only space for a single
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to du Plessis, 1 run

Commentary: thrashed through cover, and a committed dive in the deep saves the boundary
Markram checks a punch and finds point
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to Markram, no run

Commentary: inswinger, and it keeps a little low too to beat Markram's inside edge but passes harmlessly outside off
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to Markram, no run

Commentary: nicely flighted up at middle and leg, Faf driving down to long on to turn the strike over
offbreak, and Markram guides it with the spin into the leg side
Faf is half forward to press softly to cover
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: legbreak, and it's defended into the leg side with bat and pad firmly together
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: whipped off the pads and out through square leg
nudged carefully into the leg side
slashed in the air, but in the gap and bouncing down to third man
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to du Plessis, 1 run

Commentary: pushed to cover
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to Markram, no run

Commentary: his bat is broken! Markram's bat had plenty of tape on it, and as he digs out a dipping yorker the ball hits the toe end and snaps clean in half. Despite the break, it does the job of keeping the ball out!
oof! A length delivery spits at Faf, who fends and takes the bottom hand off the bat as he does so
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: beaten outside off, the ball standing up off a length
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: seaming in off the track, and it's pushed to point
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: legbreak, it keeps low as Markram jabs into the leg side
full and straight, and Faf's defence is likewise upright
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: Faf flicks off his toes, but the ball goes nowhere
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: landing on leg and spinning towards off, Faf coming forward to defend
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: offbreak this time, and he works with the spin to find a single to short fine leg
too full outside off, and it's thrashed out through cover for a brace
seaming in off a length as Faf defends
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to du Plessis, no run

Commentary: thick edge, and it's caught! Du Plessis shimmied down, trying to break the shackles, but he's undone by the lift outside off and can only send an edge through to Kusal behind the stumps
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to du Plessis, OUT
Dismissal_text: F du Plessis c †Mendis b NLTC Perera 24 (65m 42b 1x4 0x6) SR: 57.14

Commentary: Thisara hits the seam again, Rassie dealing with the inward movement and nudging to leg
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: outswinger this time, and he defends from the crease
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: pushed to cover point, on the walk, and there's no run to be had
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: this time Rassie does thread the gap at cover, getting off the mark and keeping the strike
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: speared down flat outside off, Rassie pushing to cover
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: flicked with the spin, but short fine leg is around too quickly for a single
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: legbreak, and it's an excellent one, drifting, dipping and ripping past van der Dussen's outside edge
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: chipped slightly uppishly towards that straight, short mid on, who is in position again
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: a legbreak is pushed to cover, and there's space for a single
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: punched out to the cover sweeper, off the back foot
chopped down to third man for one
a length delivery takes the inside edge and rolls to leg, the batsmen stealing a quick single
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: nicely straight from Thisara, and Markram can't make anything of it
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to Markram, no run

Commentary: an angled bat brings a single to third man
van der Dussen turns the strike back over with a drive out to the sweeper
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: powerfully driven, and right through the gap at cover. Markram checked his drive, but got an excellent connection - slightly uppish, but placed safely, and it races away
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to Markram, FOUR runs

Commentary: offbreak, Rassie stays deep and pushes it back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: squirting off the leading edge, but into space at extra cover for a single
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: Markram backs away and chops off his stumps, but he can't get it away
he's on the drive again, out to wide long off and they push hard for a second
offbreak, and it's pushed through point for a single
reverse sweep, and he nails it The shot was on as there is a huge gap down there, and he gets an excellent connection, along the ground all the way
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, FOUR runs

Commentary: inswinger, and Markram hurries his defence to keep it away from the stumps
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to Markram, no run

Commentary: fifty up for Markram, and it comes with a guide down to third man. It's his second in ODIs, his first having come on debut against Bangladesh
pushed firmly to point, off the back foot
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: good length from Thisara, and Rassie can only get half forward to it
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: this one seams away from the bat, but Rassie covers the movement and pushes out to the sweeper
Commentary_short: NLTC Perera to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: a controlled punch bounces out to the left of the sweeper, and they're back for a second to bring up the 100
looped down from around the stumps, and it's placed through cover
Commentary_short: AK Perera to van der Dussen, 1 run
AK Perera to Markram, no run

Commentary: Markram backs away and thrashes hard through cover point, pushing for a second
punched out to the sweeper, off the back foot, and another single is the result
chopped hard into the off side, and the sweeper has more work to do
Commentary_short: AK Perera to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: very full on off stump, and it's dug out back to the bowler
Commentary_short: AK Perera to Markram, no run

Commentary: Udana returns, and comes around the stumps to Rassie, who glides one off the face of the bat behind square
Commentary_short: Udana to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: there's a speculative appeal from Udana as Markram walks into a drive, but misses the shot and is hit on the pad. He looked to be outside off, and they don't ask for a review. There also might have been bat involved
punched into space at cover, and there's room for a single
Commentary_short: Udana to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: wonderful placement from Markram, waiting on some width and then lashing a cut behind point
much fuller, and it's dug out back to the bowler
flashed in the air and down to third man, the ball reaching Tharanga on the bounce and then bursting through his hands. Still just the single though
nicely dabbed by Markram, late and fine towards short third man
flighted up, and Rassies slams it straight back where it came from, the bowler pulling his hands out of the way as it was very firmly struck
Commentary_short: AK Perera to van der Dussen, FOUR runs
AK Perera to van der Dussen, no run
AK Perera to van der Dussen, no run
AK Perera to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: flighted up, and it's driven back past the bowler, along the ground this time
Commentary_short: AK Perera to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: it's short, and Rassie controls his pull down to fine leg
Commentary_short: Udana to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: slower ball, a little cutter. Markram waits on it and guides to third man
Rassie drives to mid off, and the call for a single is nice and early
Commentary_short: Udana to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: dead-batted to cover, and they pinch a quick single
dug in short, and it balloons over the batsman to be called wide
Commentary_short: Udana to van der Dussen, 1 wide

Commentary: pushed to long on for a single
Commentary_short: Udana to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: chopped down very close to the stumps, the ball bouncing up and over them
reverse sweep from Rassie, and he gets a good connection to raise the fifty stand
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, 2 runs

Commentary: speared down at his pads, Rassie clipping through square leg for a single
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: legbreak, and it's placed into space near point for a single
another legbreak, and it's much too short but turns sharply and Rassie's punch goes straight to cover
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: chipped back in the air, but well wide of Akila and down to long off
Commentary_short: Dananjaya to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: watchfully played into the leg side
and he's full to start, van der Dussen digging it out into the leg side
Commentary_short: Malinga to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: slower ball, and it's chopped through gully for a single - Markram equaling his best total in ODIs
short, and it's gloved into the leg side for one
Commentary_short: Malinga to van der Dussen, 1 run

Commentary: short, and Markram picks it up with an expansive pull - but there's protection in the deep
dug in short again, the ball fizzing up and past van der Dussen's pull
Commentary_short: Malinga to van der Dussen, no run

Commentary: bumper from Malinga, and once again the ball rises up and past van der Dussen's attempted pull
Commentary_short: Malinga to van der Dussen, no run
